title: profile#add
summary: an agent, office or organization profile was added

time.description: date & time the event was produced

agent.summary: the event provider who sent the event via a subscription authorized to your service.
agent.description:
if you are a multi-tenant app, then the agent is the user associated with the event data.
any future events related to this message will be sent to the same agent/recipient

instrument.description: the app or service that produced the event on behalf of the agent/user

source.description: a copy of the event was sent to the source(s).

originalRecipient.summary: the original recipient of the event
originalRecipient.description:
the originalRecipient helps you determine the subscription that delivered the event to you.
if the originalRecipient is the same as the agent, then the you are subscribed to the agent.
if the originalRecipient is different from the agent, then you are subscribed to the event source

id.summary: the event id - the cannonical identifier for the event
id.description:
the Event ID (aka "Publish ID") is the immutable canonical identifier for the event.
it is a URI that is unique to the event and will not change.
all subscribers will receive the same id for the same event.

@id.summary: the @id is the url in your inbox where you can retrieve the event

oneOf.title: RealEstateAgent
oneOf.description: A real estate agent who represents buyers and sellers

additionalName.title: additionalName
additionalName.description: any other name(s) associated with the entity, i.e. nickname, middle name, maiden name, etc. For multiple names, use a comma without space as a separator.
examples: Prince,The Artist Formerly Known as Prince,The Artist

certification.title: Certification
certification.description: A certification issued by an organization to an individual or business.

contactPoint.title: ContactPoint
contactPoint.description:
A point of contact for the entity. By convention in the real estate domain, ContactPoints
are preferred over telephone, email, and faxNumber so the ContactPoint.name property can be used to label values
for example, Work Telephone, Home, as named contactPoint values.

name.description: a label for the contactPoint, i.e. 'Work', or 'Home'

email.description: an email address for the item.

identifier.title: identifier
identifier.description: identifier assigned to a contact by the vendor who originally created the contact

image.title: image
image.description: an ImageObject or URI reference to an image on the web.

allOf.title: MediaObject
allOf.description: an image, video or document availble for download

allOf.title: Thing
allOf.summary: The root type of all Things.

@id.description: the liked data uri for the Thing

id.description: the URL to access the item.

name.description: the file name of the object.

about.description: URI to the subject of the image or logo

items.title: jobTitle
items.description: The job title of the person (for example, Financial Manager).

memberOf.title: memberOf
memberOf.description: an Organization (or ProgramMembership) to which this Person or Organization belongs.

anyOf.title: OrganizationRole
anyOf.description: describes a role played by a member and a group or organization.

type.description: a role played by the member in the memberOf group

memberOf.description: the org or group where the role is performed

startDate.description: date the member began performing this role

endDate.description: date the member stopped performing the role

parentOrganization.title: parentOrganization
parentOrganization.description: organizations of which this org is a part.

permit.title: Permit
permit.description: A permit issued by an organization to an individual or business.

name.description: Common or display value of the Permit.

issuedThrough.description: the service through which the permit was granted

oneOf.description: A real estate office / place of business.

allOf.title: Thing
allOf.summary: The root type of all Things.

@id.description: the liked data uri for the Thing

availableLanguage.title: availableLanguage
availableLanguage.description: Please use one of the language codes from the IETF BCP 47 standard.

name.description: the display name of the language

branchCode.description: A short textual code that uniquely identifies a place of business.
branchCode.example: for BHHS profile events, see additionalProperty.OfficeId

certification.title: certifications
certification.description: certifications granted to a person or organization

items.title: Certification
items.description: A certification issued by an organization to an individual or business.

contactPoint.description: a named point of contact - telephone, email, faxNumber, and/or url for the entity

items.title: ContactPoint
items.description:
A point of contact for the entity. By convention in the real estate domain, ContactPoints
are preferred over telephone, email, and faxNumber so the ContactPoint.name property can be used to label values
for example, Work Telephone, Home, as named contactPoint values.

name.description: a label for the contactPoint, i.e. 'Work', or 'Home'

email.description: an email address for the item.

faxNumber.description: Do people still use fax machines?

image.title: image
image.description: an ImageObject or URI reference to an image on the web.

allOf.title: MediaObject
allOf.description: an image, video or document availble for download

allOf.summary: The root type of all Things.

id.description: the URL to access the item.

logo.description: a logo associated with the organization.

allOf.title: RealEstateOrganization
allOf.description: A real estate franchisor, broker or business

areaServed.description: the physical areas that make up the ServiceArea

description.example: The number on Gotham City Real Estate Company since 1940

parentOrganization.description: A franchisor or affiliate network of which this organization plays a membership role.

numberOfSubOrganizations.description: the number of offices for an affiliate.

member.title: member
member.description: A member of an Organization or a ProgramMembership. Organizations can be members of organizations; ProgramMembership is typically for individuals.

anyOf.title: OrganizationRole

endDate.description: date the member stopped performing the role

memberOf.description: the org or group where the role is performed

startDate.description: date the member began performing this role

endDate.description: date the member stopped performing the role

subOrganization.description: Agents and teams associated with the office.
